Class UIScrollableMenu

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent

                      javax.swing.JMenu
                          com.compendium.ui.UIScrollableMenu
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.ItemSelectable, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.MenuElement, javax.swing.SwingConstants
public class UIScrollableMenu
extends javax.swing.JMenu

This class implements a scrollable menu

See Also:
Serialized Form

Nested Class Summary
private  class UIScrollableMenu.ScrollListCellRenderer
          This class implements the list renderer for the scrollable list part of the menu.
private  class UIScrollableMenu.ScrollMenu
          This inner class is used to perform the autoscrolling of nodes when they hit the edge of the view.

add

public javax.swing.JMenuItem add(javax.swing.Action a)
Creates a new menu item attached to the specified Action object and appends it to the end of this menu. As of 1.3, this is no longer the preferred method for adding Actions to a container. Instead it is recommended to configure a control with an action using setAction, and then add that control directly to the Container.

Overrides:
add in class javax.swing.JMenu
Parameters:
a - the Action for the menu item to be added

getMenuComponents

public java.awt.Component[] getMenuComponents()
Returns an array of Components of the menu's subcomponents. Note that this returns all Components in the popup menu, including separators.

Overrides:
getMenuComponents in class javax.swing.JMenu
Returns:
an array of Components or an empty array if there is no popup menu
